column4: hi eeverybody! My  Asus EEE-PC shows the message: "(initramfs)". What am I supposed to do?
do what?
i do not understand the problem
initramfs is saying its loading the kernel into ram is it sticking there?
thats bad seems like you smoked the fs
filesystem you can try to boot recovery and reinstall the kernel might get it back
press escape when grub pops up you have to be quick with it
being thats the same hotkey for boot slect
passes the eepc splash not ubuntu
to soon you will get boot menu to late it will just boot like normal its a bit of a pain
same error?
i think you might have to just reinsall hate to say that but if you cant get to at least recovery its kinda the only option
:( id your sssd failing
are you trying to use btrfs
that failes
thats the issue btrfs is broken on 11.10 use ext2 it should work fine
btrfs thinks your drive is always full causing the install to fail
on partating slect advanced or maunal and in the menu slect ext2 rather then btrfs
if your drives ssd slect 1 single partation with no swap
i thought you installed it before
on the partating screen simply slect something else thats advanced
